Authors:
Susumu Takamatsu, Siska Arie Siahaan, Onésimo Moreno-Rico,
Silvia M. Wolcan, Maria G. Cabrera de Alvarez, Uwe Braun
Title:
Early evolution of endo-parasitism in powdery mildews:
molecular phylogeny suggests missing link between Phyllactinia and
Leveillula
Abstract:
Of the 17 genera of the Erysiphaceae, only four genera,
viz. Leveillula, Phyllactinia, Pleochaeta, and Queirozia, exhibit
(partly) endo-parasitism. To investigate early evolution of
endo-parasitism in powdery mildews, we performed molecular phylogenetic
analyses of powdery mildews belonging to the tribe Phyllactinieae
collected in North & South America. The most ancestral taxa in the
tribe Phyllactinieae belong to the Pleochaeta/Queirozia group from which
the genus Phyllactinia was derived. Finally, the truely endo-parasitic
genus Leveillula emerged from a part of Phyllactinia. The present study
showed clear evolutional polarity in the powdery mildews concerned, that
is, partly endo-parasitic groups evolved from ecto-parasitic groups, and
then a truely endo-parasitic group emerged finally from a partly
endo-parasitic group. In addition, a group with distinctly dimorphic
conidia proved to be basal in the Phyllactinieae, and a group without
distinct dimorphic conidia was derived from the former group. The
present analyses clearly showed that Leveillula was derived from a part
of the “Basal Phyllactinia group”. However, all sister taxa to
Leveillula were distributed in North & South America. Because the
putative geographic origin of Leveillula is assumed to be Central &
West Asia or Mediterranean region, we have to postulate the presence of
a missing link during the evolution of Leveillula from Phyllactinia.
Based on the present phylogenetic studies and the new rules of the
“International Code of Nomenclature for Algae, Fungi, and Plants”, the
following taxonomic reallocations are proposed: Phyllactinia
bougainvilleae sp. nov., P. caricae comb. nov., P. caricicola comb.
nov., P. durantae comb. nov., P. leveilluloides sp. nov., P. obclavata
comb. nov., P. papayae comb. nov.
